lineFollowerSim

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.UI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants

    public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
implements PConstants
    simple GUI (documentation not complete)

    Push Buttons

    Check Box click on button to toggle check box

    Radio Button -- hack for now for page select buttons, may not be supported

    Value Button integer value , min,max range

    Text Box edit string

    Author:
    Ron Grant

    • Constructor Detail

      • UI

        public UI(PApplet parent)
        UI - UserInterface Class Supports definition of controls (buttons,check boxes,text boxes, integer and float value controls..

        Allows user to write response code, for simplicity, called as a chain of if() statements. This documentation is far from complete. At preset see user code in LFS Application , LFS_G tab.

        Parameters:
        parent - Reference to parent applet (processing applet)

    • Method Detail

      • setVisibleGroups

        public void setVisibleGroups(int groups)
        Define visible button groups as multi digit decimal number which is encoded into a mask used to determine button visibility based on their group definition 0..9. For example 123 indicates button groups 1,2 and 3 will be visible.
        Parameters:
        groups - multi digit number comprising all visible button groups.

      • setHintLocation

        public void setHintLocation(int x,
                            int y)
        Set location on screen where hint text (if defined) will appear on screen.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal offset from left side of screen
        y - vertical offset from top of screen

      • hintEnable

        public void hintEnable(boolean e)

      • setValEditRect

        public void setValEditRect(int x,
                           int y,
                           int w,
                           int h)
        Location for Value Editor used when value button clicked on
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal offset from left side of screen
        y - vertical offset from top of screen
        w - value editor panel width in pixels
        h - value editor panel height in pixels

      • setButtonOrigin

        public void setButtonOrigin(int x,
                            int y)
        New control positioning: Location x,y of button array gotoCol(1) location.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal offset from left side of screen
        y - vertical offset from top of screen

        public void setButtonYMax(int ymax)
        New control positioning: Max Y of buttons being auto positioned, where column is incremented and row count reset
        Parameters:
        ymax -

      • setButtonHeight

        public void setButtonHeight(int h)
        New control positioning: Defines the height of button bounding rectangle
        Parameters:
        h - height in pixels

      • setRowHeight

        public void setRowHeight(int h)
        New control sizing: Defines the row total size, this should be greater than button height
        Parameters:
        h - height in pixels

      • setButtonPos

        public void setButtonPos(int x,
                         int y)
        Set button x,y loction. This overrides auto positioning
        Parameters:
        x - Offset from left side of screen
        y - Offset from top of screen

      • setButtonWidth

        public void setButtonWidth(int w)
        New control positioning: Set button bounding rectangle width in pixels
        Parameters:
        w - width in pixels

      • setColWidth

        public void setColWidth(int w)
        New control sizing: Sets column width for calculation of next column spacing, this value should be greater than button width
        Parameters:
        w - button width in pixels

      • setDeltaColRow

        public void setDeltaColRow(float dc,
                           float dr)
        New control positioning: Set col,row increment applied as controls are created, e.g. (0,1) move down the page
        Parameters:
        dc - delta column value typically 0 or 1, but can be adjusted, e.g. 1.1 for more space..
        dr - delta row value typically 0 or 1, but can be adjusted, e.g. 1.1 to increase spacing.

      • setLeftJustify

        public void setLeftJustify()
        Button/Label Text for subsequent controls will be left justified

        public void setCenterJustify()
        Button/Label Text for subsequent controls will be center justtified

      • gotoCol

        public void gotoCol(int n)
        New control positioning: Move to new column for for subsequent control placement, row set to 0
        Parameters:
        n - column number 1,2,3...

      • nextPos

        public void nextPos()
        New control positioning: Auto advance to next position, skip a button location using current delta set with setDeltaColRow

      • moveColRow

        public void moveColRow(float dc,
                       float dr)
        New control positioning: Advance to next position manually specified here delta row, deta col distance.
        Parameters:
        dc - Change in column position.
        dr - Change in row position.

      • btn

        public UIButton btn(java.lang.String s,
                    java.lang.String cmd,
                    java.lang.String hint)
        Define button, with unique command, and hint string.
        Parameters:
        s - Button label
        cmd - Button resulting command string (when clicked)
        hint - Button Hint string
        Returns:
        optional reference to button assigned to UIButton variable

      • btnc

        public UIButton btnc(java.lang.String s,
                     java.lang.String hint)
        Define button where label = command, also include hint
        Parameters:
        s - label of button and command returned when button clicked
        hint - Hint string than can be displayed when button is hovered over with mouse
        Returns:
        optional reference to button assigned to UIButton variable

      • group

        public void group(int groupNum)
        Define button group number 1..9 for subsequent control definitions. Buttons can then be selectively displayed using setVisibleGroups method.
        Parameters:
        groupNum - number 1..9

      • valueEditorUpdate

        public void valueEditorUpdate()

      • drawButtons

        public void drawButtons(int mask)

      • update

        public UIButton update()
        Called by application program, to draw currently visible buttons and to return a reference to clicked button, if none clicked returns null.
        Returns:
        Clicked button reference, or null if no button clicked.

      • cmd

        public boolean cmd(java.lang.String keyStr)

      • beginDecode

        public void beginDecode(UIButton b)
        This method should be called with reference to clicked button provided by update() method before chain of if(ui.cmd("label")) do action statements.
        Parameters:
        b - Current button that has been clicked.

      • endCmdDecode

        public boolean endCmdDecode()
        Call this method after all if(ui.cmd("ButtonCmd") do action have been executed ,where it informs program if a command has been decoded by one of the if statements.
        Returns:
        true if the button was decoded, if not and error message is warranted.
